tn.text: Joel continues poetry that began in the previous chapter. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Blow the trumpet ... sound an alarm
tn.text: Joel is emphasizing the importance of calling Israel together in preparation for the destruction that is coming.

The words "darkness" and "gloom" share similar meanings and emphasize the intensity of darkness. Both words refer to a time of disaster or divine judgment. AT: "a day that is full of darkness" or "a day of terrible judgment." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
total or partial darkness

tn.ref: day of clouds and thick darkness
tn.text: This phrase means the same thing as, and intensifies the idea of the previous phrase. Like that phrase, both "clouds" and "thick darkness" refer to divine judgment. AT: "a day full of dark storm clouds." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Like the dawn that spreads on the mountains, a large and mighty army is approaching
tn.text: AT: "A large, mighty army comes over the mountains into the land. They spread over the land like the light from the rising sun" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

The words "large" and "mighty" share similar meanings here and emphasize the strength of the army. AT: "A huge swarm of locusts" (UDB) or "a very large human army." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Joel's description of the coming army continues.

tn.ref: land is like the garden of Eden
tn.text: The garden of Eden was a beautiful place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: The land is like the garden of Eden in front of it, but behind it there is a ruined wilderness
tn.text: This is showing a contrast to highlight the destruction the fire is producing.
The description continues with the noises of an army of horses.
A large and fast animal with four legs. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: The army's appearance is like horses
tn.text: The head of a locust looks like a small horse head and the army is strong and fast like a horse. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
The army moves quickly, as men riding horses would. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
A horse jumps or leaps as it runs quickly.

tn.ref: a noise like that of chariots ... like the noise of fiery flames ... like a mighty army ready for battle
tn.text: These are compared to the noise of the locust army. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Joel continues to describe the locust army of Yahweh.

tn.ref: They run like mighty warriors ... climb the walls like soldier
tn.text: The army of locusts are described as acting like real soldiers would. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
walls around the cities
The description of the locust army of Yahweh continues.
AT: they overcome the soldiers defending the city.

tn.ref: The earth shakes in front of them, the heavens tremble, the sun and the moon are darkened, and the stars stop shining
tn.text: There are so many locusts that the earth and sky shakes, and the all the objects in the sky cannot be seen. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Yahweh shows God's power and command over the army. AT: "Yahweh has control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
In this phrase both descriptions mean basically the same thing. AT: "greatly terrible" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hendiadys]])
AT: "No one will be strong enough to survive Yahweh's judgment." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Return to me with all your heart
tn.text: AT: "Turn away from your sins and be totally devoted to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]).

tn.ref: Tear your heart and not only your garments
tn.text: Tearing one's clothes is an outward act of shame or repentance. "Tear you heart" refers to having an inward attitude of repentance as well. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
stop
"Perhaps Yahweh will turn from his anger ... God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
rooms, usually in the parents' houses, where brides would wait for their wedding ceremonies
the people of Israel, who are God's special people (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Why should they say among the nations, 'Where is their God?'
tn.text: AT: "Other nations should not say the God of Israel has abandoned his people." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]]).
"the nation of Israel"
"the people of Israel"
"Pay attention to what I am about to say"
"unworthy of respect"
God continues his promise to Israel.
These directions are from the perspective of people living in the land of Israel.
"Do not be afraid, you people of the land," (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]])
plants good for food will grow on the land

tn.ref: autumn rain and the spring rain
tn.text: the first rains of the rainy season in early December and the last rains in April and May
large containers for liquids

tn.ref: the years of crops that the swarming locust has eaten
tn.text: "the crops that you took care of for years and that the swarming locusts have eaten"

tn.ref: swarming locust ... the great locust, the devouring locust, and the destroying locust
tn.text: See how you translated these words in [[:en:bible:notes:jol:01:04|1:4]].
Yahweh continues to promise good things for the people of Israel.
God continues to promise good things for the people of Israel.

tn.ref: I will pour out my Spirit
tn.text: "I will give generously the way a person pours out water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"all people"
Yahweh continues speaking of things he will do in the future.

tn.ref: blood, fire and pillars of smoke
tn.text: "blood" is symbolizing the death of people. AT: "death, fire and pillars of smoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here the word "blood" refers to the color red. You can supply the verb for this phrase. AT: "and the moon will turn red like blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Here the word "great" modifies the word "terrible." AT: "greatly terrifying day." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hendiadys]])

tn.ref: on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem
tn.text: These refer to the same place. AT: "on Mount Zion in Jerusalem." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: among the survivors, those whom Yahweh calls
tn.text: AT: "those whom Yahweh calls will be survivors"
people who live through a terrible event like a war or a disaster
